title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message:
[PLAIN][solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu[/PLAIN]

I have a Mid 2013 MacBook Air with the 820-3437-A motherboard. Keyboard and Trackpad are not recognized in OS X but does work fine under the boot menu and ASD EFI. I have tried a fresh install of OS X but did not fix anything. Board shows no signs of liquid damage. ASD passes under both EFI and OS. Anyone have any idea what could be causing this?

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message:
I've been trying to solve this one for six months now on 3437s and no clue. duke has a retina that does the same shit. I have a retina that does the same shit!! This is one of those white whales that even we are totally stumped by(hey,we don't know [I]everything[/I]).

Maybe you can help us solve it?  What was the original damage on this machine?

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: Hmm. As far as i know nothing. I bought it like this from another guy at my college who just bought another one. I suppose the keyboard or trackpad could have suffered some light liquid damage that i wasn't told about but it shows absolutely no signs of any liquid. Also some how i forgot to mention this but the left USB port does not work as well but I don't think that has anything to do with it as the keyboard still works under the boot menu.

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message:
No Title

Maybe you've just given us the a hint! Look at the data lines of the trackpad they end in the USB hub of the processor/PCH as well as the other USB devices and ports do.
Does the faulty USB port works when the trackpad works?

I'm thinking out loud: what if you sacrifice on functioning USB-Port and you use its data lines to connect the data lines of the trackpad to it....

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: Trackpad/keyboard works through USB in EFI mode. In OSX it works through SPI. SPI lines go to CPU/PCH, so my guess is a dead CPU. Of course I am assuming that your connector/cable and trackpad are all known good and tested.

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: So i was just messing around with it a little more today and decided to flip the trackpad cable around plugging the trackpad end into the motherboard and to my suprise it now works. So im guessing either SMC_LSOC_RST_L or TPAD_USB_IF_EN_CONN was broken in the cable and is now a ground line on the other side. Either way I went ahead and ordered a new cable. Now to figure out this USB issue

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: That flat cable is the #1 part I replace here on MacBooks. Order some more there will be many more needed in the future. Same goes for the IO board and cable.

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: Also the USB issue is probably the IO board or the cable to it.

title: [solved]MacBook Air Mid 2013 820-3437 No Keyboard and Mouse in OS But works in Option menu
message: Yep it was the IO board.
